text:
The portion here is so small compared to the one we used to go to. We ordered both a bowl and burrito. Normally my burrito is bulging and I'd have left overs because I get full once I got to a quarter of it left. I was still hungry here. The portion the burrito was lacking everything. So was the bowl. You'd need to order two if they continue doing it this way. 

This location didn't put enough meat and rice in it especially. I won't be making frequent visits here.
Not realizing what time it was, I walked in at exactly 9:59 PM. I felt guilty but every employee was happy to help me and they were not at all rushed. Plus I got some bomb chicken tacos ;)

This is a really good Chipotle location. Exterior is clean, and free of panhandlers. Inside is neat and clean, including the counter where the delicious food is prep. 

The staff is nice, especially Julie. Honestly she's what makes this location what it is. She's extremely respectful and in my 60 seconds dealing with her, she turns a bad day to good, or a good day ten times better. 

The food speakers for itself, AMAZING!

My wife and I decided to give Chipotle a shot after the food fiasco they've encountered over the past 6 months.  We ordered via the phone app and there were no problems, easy and convenient.  However, we got home and unpacked our food..  our kids chicken quesadilla had no chicken!  It only had guacamole and bell peppers on the side.  To make matters worse the fruit that came with their meal was an orange that had fungus and rotten on the inside.  Ugh!  Doubt we'll be back which kinda sucks because it's very close to our home.
I got horrendous food poisoning, threw up violently, got hot and cold chills, headache, body aches. I don't recommend going to this location for your Chipotle fix.  :,(

Poor customer service! Every time I come here I get charged a different amount and the proportions are always different for the exact same thing ordered. This is the closest one to my house,so I'm forced to suffer through incompetence and poor management.

Very disappointed & my family will never go back .
The chicken was all dark meat and had a. slimy texture. The brown rice, avacado, black beans, & salsa were very good. However, I was unable to enjoy those items with the nasty slimy meat chicken & beef.
Additionally, the kids quesadilla was the size for a toddler NOT the standards  "kid" size & it definatly was not worth  $3.75 it was smaller then a sandwich!!

I felt I waisted my money & will never return.

Does not even deserve one star! Every time in the evening, there seems to be a mexican girl working there with black hair and blonde tips, that usually just stands there and gives everyone dirty looks and stands in line where the sauces and vegetables are. I have read the reviews and many others have noticed her very rude and unprofessional behavior, she just throws the bowls, and when you tell her what you don't want, she will ignore you. Not a difficult job, all you have to do is be nice, and listen to what the customers want in their food, but apparently she is not even capable of that. Not sure why this person works there, if they are just being rude to customers, what's going on with Chipotle's management on this location?

Even though it's in a very busy shopping center I've never had to wait a long time in line here because the workers are fast which is great! Never had an issue with bad service. The employees have always been kind and courteous to me and obviously the food is fantastic so I can't complain at all!

I love chipotle, I always order sofritas and no matter the bowl, burrito or tacos its fan-fucking-tastic. The tofu is beautifully marinated and cooked so perfectly its ridiculous that anyone could be afraid to try it. I've only ever had ONE bad experience from this shop where a piece of chicken was in my bowl and I accidentally ate it. Which made me sick and that's the only reason I'm not giving five stars. The restaurant itself is very clean and the workers are friendly
Always consistent. Everyone is always friendly and they always make your food well. Thanks for always doing a great job with our food.

I hate to give Chipotle a bad review because we love eating there. We have only eaten at this location twice but got sick both times. 

The first time we thought it might be a mistake, so I went back six months later because I love Chipotle (summer 2011). Got sick again. I suppose I should have called the health department. I was conflicted because the young girl was nice to my dog and gave him meat in a bowl and water. 

I eat at other Chipotles and never had a problem. Won't eat here again.

This chipotle suck
The food was cold,the meat was disgusting 
My boyfriend got home and got serious hard- core diarrhea 
  Not recommended 
Go somewhere else

I come back to this Chipotle just for the convenience factor and because I F***ING LOVE CHIPOTLE (and so does my gf). The people who work here are super sweet & kind. Only criticisms: steak is not well-cooked enough, guacamole is WAY too chunky (as compared to other Chipotles). I wonder if someone who works there (manager or something???) prefers their steak rare and their guacamole chunky. I'm not super into it but I'll bear it for the convenience of a Chipotle two feet from my apartment with good, kind service.

This location was phenomenal! Especially the young girl who rang myself and my husband up! She never stopped either ringing up customers, cleaning, and being extremely friendly the entire time! She lives for customer service and I can see her going a long way in the future!

Big Chipotle fans, but we will not be returning to this location again.

I always order the same thing when I go to Chipotle and there are only two things I request: no beans & no cheese. Somehow my order was literally covered with cheese, as well as excessive rice & minimal meat. I ate less than half because I felt like it was JUST rice & cheese! I also asked for extra lettuce... yet look at my photo. I wouldn't even say that qualified as a handful let alone extra lettuce. 

FOR HER: I always order a CHICKEN BURRITO BOWL -- white rice, no beans or cheese, pico, corn & extra lettuce. 

FOR HIM: He orders the STEAK BURRITO -- white rice, black beans on the side, spicy salsa, no cheese & guacamole.
Went in late afternoon I think the chicken must have been left over from lunch. Very disappointed. It was basically terrible.

This place always hits the spot! Nothing better than a delicious steak salad.  
I had my dog with me and they allowed me to bring her to the patio area. even one of the employees offered me more water for her! it's very nice to find a place that is dog friendly with delicious food. if you're a health freak Chipotle is definitely a place for you!!!

The staff here is always friendly and attentive to my orders. The only reason its not 5 stars is more due to the company than the location. The onion and peppers could use some red peppers, onions cut smaller and cooked longer. I think this is a company thing since I've seen this at other locations.
Great tacos. Speedy prep from friendly employees.

My wife loves this place regardless of where we are, but I just don't have that same love for Chipotle as she does. LOL - Well, there was one down the street from where we were staying last week, so we stopped by for lunch. Their staff is very enthusiastic as they greet you with a huge hello, how are ya as soon as you enter the business. They menu is, of course, the same as all the others, but the black beans just tasted better than usual, for some reason. I just got the bowl with barbacoa to keep it safe because I've been known as a bit of a "Tortilla Snob"...haha, but this plate was very, very good. I was absolutely impressed with the taste of this dish and will definitely go back the next time we're in town visiting our daughter!
#KudosOnTheEnthusiasm

80% of the workers here are very rude. Usually the female teens who are mean for no reason to customers. The condiment counter is dirty usually around night, which is kind of gross, but most of the time it's clean. The food is always so good. I haven't ever gone back to this location though, and don't really plan to because of the employees.
This is a great Chipotle location. The staff were all friendly, and I was in and out in literally 3 minutes. Also the sofritas could make a grown meat eater cry from deliciousness.

Kind of weird to review Chipotle as they are probably all the same but seeing as how we eat here more than anywhere else in the area, I might as well. 

The people always give a friendly greeting when you walk in, the food is consistent, and the place is kept clean. 

The only thing I'd change is the time when found a little piece of plastic bag in my burrito bowl and was treated like I was crazy for thinking it was unacceptable. (?)  Their response when I showed them was "oh." 

Anyways, it's Chipotle and it is good. Even with little bits of plastic bag thrown in every once in a blue moon.

I've always loved Chipotle, they have great food and they are usually good to make things right.

I came and had dinner with a few friends when they discovered their meat was cold. We asked if they had could fix it, and they offered to remake it, which was acceptable. The manager on duty seemed to have an attitude with fixing our orders, advising that "oh, the meat is at perfect temperature," after having just rotated and mixed the meat, moving the bottom meat to the top, where the bottom meat was warm.

The drink station / condiment bar was messy, and unstocked: there were no spoons, forks, and knives. We also had to ask again for assistance and received further attitude on getting the items we need.

I typically don't get this kind of service from chipotle, I hope this is just a one time occurrence.

My husband and I went to this shopping center for pizza but the line was crazy so we had Chipotle instead. As soon as we walked in we were greeted. The girls behind the counter were bubbly and joked with us the whole time we were there. The serving sizes were big and the food tasted amazing. One of the best locations I've been too. We live closer to a different location but we will definitely make the trip up to this one from now on. Thank you!

Wow...had the most racist experience ever at this Chipotle tonight. I ordered a chicken bowl, and when it was time to pay my bowl was $11. I asked why and the cashier stated that I got a chicken with extra steak bowl. I advised her that I did not and that I only got chicken and that it was labeled incorrectly. She asked the girl who made and labeled my bowl and she said that she remembers making a chicken with extra steak bowl for me. I advised her that she did not, that I ordered a chicken bowl and watched her make it and there's no steak. There was another female worker by the cashier who noticed that the other guy in front of me had a chicken with extra steak bowl and she pointed that out to the worker who made my bowl . They opened up my bowl and sure enough it was only chicken. To make a long story short I'm black and so was the other guy that actually ordered the chicken with extra steak bowl. I guess to this worker all black people look the same and she could not differentiate between myself and the other customer who actually ordered a chicken with steak bowl.  The other disappointment with this experience is that the store manager was right there during this ordeal and did not do anything to apologize or appropriately address the situation. I was issued a $3.41 refund for the steak that they accidentally charged me for, and I guess to them that was appropriate. Worst customer service and most racist and stereotypical experience ever!!!!!!!!! Very disappointing!!

This is one of my favorite Mexican style fast food joints. The burrito bowls here are great and service is always fast even when there's a long line. When you order, you tell them what you want from start to finish and they'll make your order right in front of you. I would recommend chicken or carnitas (roast pork) for your meats since that's what I typically get. The only downside to this particular location is the parking...it's located in a busy shopping area with a bunch of restaurants in close proximity so you would be better off parking further back and walking, rather than try to fight for a spot upfront.

I'm a big Chipotle fan in general,  but this location specifically seems to have it together. The staff has always been friendly, the ingredients always seem to be fresh, and the restaurant stays pretty clean. Plus, it's next door to a Golden Spoon and a Starbucks in case you want to chase the heat with something sweet :)

Came in for a quick lunch, quick service,food was really fresh,like usual! I got a brown rice chicken bowl, but I'll be sticking with white rice!

Return factor: yep!

I love the barbacoa soft tacos. I always have barbacoa and sometimes I add chicken for a little 1/2 1/2 love. I love the tacos with corn salsa, cheese and sour cream. Plus, the girls at the Durango location are awesome. I always feel welcome and the line goes super fast.

These Burritos Suck!
I should have known better than to go back to this ratchet Chipotle. But it's the closest one around, if I didn't have a gift card I wouldn't have went. Anyway I don't know why, the female staff is so rude but it's really sad. A bunch of haters.smh... Anyway . It's this rude cashier, she's very sarcastic and corny and she's always going out of her way to give me a hard time. Today she told me and several ridiculous comments, she even started discussing aloud a previous incident in which a chipotle employee basically swapped a gift card I had purchased with an employee card. During that previous visit this same cashier pretended she didn't know how to do her job. Even after showing this cashier my receipt she pretends it's nothing that can be done. Luckily the cameras work really good, and the transactions are all filmed!!! And that is why I got the gift cards I used today, because she was rude then too, trying to embarrass people with her clown glasses on . So tonight she was acting ridiculous, pretending she didn't know how to do her job. I explain to her that I was told the items must be rung up separately, then she says " I'm so sorry for your rudeness". That comment stated an argument with myself and the cashier because I couldn't believe the disrespect. Another employee came up trying to help and after I explained what she said, he was just as shocked as I was. He asks her why she said that and she says " Well she is bring rude" thenrandomly she  YELLS "Im sorry that your card was declined your last visit." That's why I was put into a situation in  which I had to be loud, like immature loud cashier and set the record straight. They called the manager for me because I had asked for her,when she came  she was rude like her employee. She told me she disused me with her employees and she feels it's nothing that can be done. Oh how disappointing no wonder these employees lack of professionalism. The manager was rude. It's obvious she encourages the disrespect as well. I got a call back from someone who offered me a buy one get one. Nah. I'll pass.

We go to chipotle all the time and we order the same thing every time 30$ for 3 burritos and this location is the worst.. bad service and the people who prepare the food are no bueno.. won't hit this location I recommend going to other locations this one SUCKS!

Chipotle is generally good all the time. There are rare occasions in which the ingredients are just old and aren't made properly, but that never has been the case for me at this location. Most of the time, they are very consistent.

If you have never been to Chipotle, it is somewhat different from other restaurants. The customer goes through an ingredient buffet in which they pick ingredients that they would want in their burrito or bowl. Other additions include drinks, small tortillas, and salsa. This location lets you refill your own drinks.

I always get a chicken or carnitas bowl. You can get two kinds of meat, but that is extra. I do not get the steak because it is not well done. I can't comment on their beans because I am not a bean fan (don't they make you fart?), but my boyfriend seems to like them and gets them every time. They don't charge extra for rice, beans, or lettuce. I've seen people get burritos so big that they have to wrap them with two large tortillas!

I can't finish a bowl in one setting, but I think it is tasty as leftovers. I really like their food here (and all the other Chipotles). It is simple, consistent, and delish!

Never met a Burrito I didn't like.  Especially when they are as big as your head.  At least that is how they usually make them for me.   I always get extra everything like cheese, sour cream, salsas, and lettuce. When this thing is done it looks like a "Bob Marley" Spliff, big and fat.  I do hate when they rip the tortilla and have to roll it up in a 2nd one.  No Bueno. It will still do the trick.  I am not sure why but I see lots of people getting burrito bowls. Not my preference but to each is own.

This is the closest one to my house which is unfortunate. There always seems to be a lot of turnover and there is always someone new. The service is horrible with managers that just do not care. They are the worst chipotle ever. Either meats are charred and over cooked or really under cooked. Rice crunches which is wrong. They struggle to get people through the line because they stop everything to coach a new person and lots of just standing around while food gets cold. Get some good management (can't be too difficult) and keep the employees you have.
Keeping up the high standards of the rest of the chain for healthy prompt quick tex mex style food.

Typical Chipotle restaurant. I prefer this place over Qdoba any day because of their awesome-sized burritos and tasty chicken.  However, I wish this franchise supported the military and offered a discount to the vets. Cost to eat there gets pricey w/my appetite, but still enjoyable to eat once in a blue moon.
I've been there 5 times now, this location is no different than the many others I've visited. Good food, good portions, clean environment, friendly staff. I'll be back

The staff was friendly and always attentive. There had a customer before me that was giving the food prep girl a hard time for no reason. Yes the girl stood there and smiled the whole time. She never broke her smile. The food was delicious. The prep people always listen to what you order and know exactly what I want every time I return. I love the atmosphere and the food. I will always go back
I love Chipotle.. But this location has been, Meh, for me. It's been dirty several times, and they're light handed when it comes to portions of rice.
Solid service, fresh ingredients, and delicious vegetarian options. Love the lime seasoning on the tortilla chips, and it's hard to beat the price for the amount of food given.

I have heard so many good things about Chipotle's, but had never been. I was working in the area and a coworker invited me to lunch there.

I had a steak burrito. Steak, beans, rice, salsa, cheese and sour cream. 

Since this is my first time at the restaurant chain I don't know what is normal there, but I know I'm not used to a burrito being served cold. The rice and beans were room temperature, but the steak was refrigerator cold. This was thirty seconds after it was made. The cold temperature aside, the flavor was good. The steak was tasty, I think it would have been better warm. The burrito, in general, would have been better warm.

Call me a traditionalist, but I like cold foods (ice cream, salads) served cold and warm/hot food served warm/hot. I'm not above having a ham dinner warm and a ham sandwich the next day cold, since I know how long it sat out before the refrigerator.

As I said, the burrito was tasty and if you like your burritos cold, you will probably like it a lot. 

Next time I will just go the Roberto's, I like their product and they serve the burritos warm.
To slow, too busy talking when prepping my food instead of just making the food. Lighting is too dark also, and food isn't as fresh as I'd like. Won't be coming back to this location.

Why are the reviews here bad? Seriously, this Chipotle is amazing! I literally went within an hour of closing and the service there was probably the best I've ever had from any restaurant EVER! To be honest, I hadn't been in a Chipotle in quite a while but because of the craze amaze service I had here tonight, I will be back soon. Sometimes, it's just nice to be treated exceptionally above and beyond what you deserve. It felt like I was going to hang out with friends at this chipotle, that's how great the employees are here! And the food? Phenomenal, just like it always is at almost every chipotle I've ever been to! Thank you chipotle at Montecito!! You make my day!

This Chipotle has had consistently good service for years. Everybody knows about the food, so I know I don't need to go too in depth but my go-to is a bowl with white rice, chicken, mild salsa, cheese, and sour cream. They know you know guac is extra; they still have to tell you in case somebody doesn't know in order to avoid potential butthurt. Don't be a jerk about it; just tell them "That's fine" with a smile.
The parking lot situation at this location sucks, however. It isn't their fault; there is definitely just way too many buildings in this strip mall for the number of parking spaces.
Friendly and fast! Chips aren't really fresh, ever. Lol but I assume it's out of some people's control

It's Chipotle.  For the most part, if you've been to one, you've been to them all.  I don't mind Chipotle, in general, but it's probably not my favorite.  It will totally do in a pinch though.  We've had a variety of menu items here and they've all been good enough. I generally trend towards the bowls to try and keep the carbs/calories down.  The burritos are tasty too. Service is fast and efficient enough, especially since this place gets jam packed.
Came here twice and both times there were no lettuce for the salad and no way to substitute for other ingredients. Terrible.
Who doesn't love chipotle? It's quick and delicious. The people here are really friendly and aren't stingy like other ones. I always get the tacos but everything is good here!

I love Chipotle.  This is my home away from home.  This location especially because it has a nice setting that offers outdoor seating in a courtyard with stone facade and vines growing up the walls.  It's pretty nice for a Chipotle.  They also have a frozen yogurt place next door for desert, and a Starbucks next to that.  My only complaint is that the parking can be a little hard to come by since it's a busy plaza (but still worth a few extra steps to enjoy some fresh Chipotle).

I'm a Chipolte fan but this place scored low for me. They rush on the line and you have to yell to stop them from putting in rice. They are EXTREMELY skimpy with the meat and pile on mountains of pico. For chipotles standards this place is low.

Like everyone else, I love chipotle. 
The employees at this location are always friendly. I wanted to give it a 5 but my online order turned out to be way off. 
I asked for half the amount of normal rice, extra pico. I got the opposite. Also, I had to spit out 4 pieces of chicken because they were actually large pieces of fat. Yuck! 
I was disappointed that they put my 3 kids milks with the hot food in the bag (they were in there when I picked up), so they were all warm. 
Hoping this was a fluke.
One of my quick stop food joints when I'm not in the mood for a burger...I always get their chicken bowl or burrito with a good dose of Chipotle Tabasco....ALOHA!!!

Initially our order of five bowls was incorrect.  We have some allergy issues, and some in our party cannot eat pinto beans.  Needless to say, the first time we ordered it was a disaster. 

HOWEVER, Kyeara (and apprentice and manager I think) worked with us to make sure the order was correct for the next time.  She was sensitive to our issues and didn't waste our energy or time by arguing who was right and who was wrong.  She was professional and represented Chipotle the way we expect.

Since this incident, we've been to this location two more times and have experienced good service (with smiles!) and good food.   Kyeara changed our mind about the place!

Food is always great but they need more staff. Ordered online hoping to avoid the usual wait and here I am, having several people taken ahead of me and my online order was set to be done before I got here and it hasn't even been looked at. They weren't even aware I had placed an online order. Don't offer the service if you can't keep up with it.

Went here today and had an overall poor experience. The food wasn't very good. This seems to be a theme here; sometimes the food is great and other times it's not good at all. The ice machine was broken today so I had to go next door and got ice from the pizza place. Then I discovered their sodas are all flat! Asked for a refund, which they did. But I still didn't have anything to drink with my meal. Also the chairs in here are quite uncomfortable for my small frame.

This place is always pretty busy, and the quality of food is the same at every chain I've been to. The service is always usually good, and they aren't cheap with the meat. Last night was the first time I had a rude food preparer. If she had a name tag on I probably would have said something to a manager. Yep. It was that bad. But usually it's great, so 4 stars it is!

Stopped by the Fedex Kinko's Store next door around lunchtime and was hungry for some Mexican Food.  Luckily, this Chipotle is only steps away.

I went for the Steak Burrito had them put Rice, Pinto Beans, Hot Sauce, Sour Cream, and Guacamole in the Burrito.  The Burrito was solid as usual for a Chipotle.  The Guacamole & Sour Cream makes the Burrito for me.  The Rice has just the right amount of Lemon juice on it to give it that slight tart flavor.....and the Hot Sauce has a nice kick to it.

I think they do a really good job because they have such a small menu and focus on providing consistent product.

Will I return?  You bet.
Tried using the app to order. It definitely needs work but the service on the restaurant was great & fixed the issues. The food was very good. Chips are seasoned well & are really good!

Basically what I would expect from a chipotle. They were busy and seemed a little out of sorts from app orders. The food was okay, but the service wasn't great. I honestly felt ignored with no eye contact after the first employee did a great job of greeting me.

What's going on? I've been coming here close to a year and the last month or so the service for take out/ friendly service has been horrible! Upon asking for your dish, it just sit there while the cast register guy takes forever and the food is cold! There is a line backing up and there is no sense of urgency! Hope this gets resolved fast! All the other chipotle restaurants service is fast friendly and your meal is hot.

"Just let me go we'll meet again soon
"Now wait, wait, wait for me
"Please hang around
"I'll see you when I fall asleep"

-------------------------------------

In A Sentence
A faux-Mexican chain conveniently located in the far-North neighbourhood of Centennial. (Winter is Coming®.)

Quick Review
+ Chicken, pork*, steak, soy, vegetarian burritos/bowls, et cetera. They run through their queues fast as hell now (post-2015 scandal). (*Overheard today: "is carnitas pork?" Heh.) 

- Nickel and diming: 2$ upcharge for guacamole? Bruv, an USDA-certified organic avocado is a buck at Smith's across the lot. 

Employee of Excellence
+ The cashier/till employee's right-hand woman, typically the conduit between the Ford assembly line and the cashier, who noticed tonight that I had left my fancy phone on the wooding that frames the till area after having placed it there to get my free burrito offer scanned. 

-------------------------------------

I'm the undisputed Duke of this establishment -- dusts crown -- therefore I suppose I will review. (Flagtrolls, get ready to flag. Morons at HQ, get ready to take it down.) 

The first time I patronised the Chipotle Mexican Grill® chain was a decade ago in the U.S. midwest. Burritos in Minnesota. There is a difference between choosing to get faux-Mexican in a location where no authentic Mexican exists and doing so in Nevada, where there are countless authentic choices to select from. I stopped coming because of a) SYSCO delivery I witnessed at another valley Chipotle location; and b) there is a Roberto's* on the other end of this same block (inside Terrible's®).

(*That is not remotely authentic either; however, it is closer on the Mejico spectrum.)

In any case, something always is promoted to bring us back. Marketing geniuses aren't paid the big bucks to sit around and do nothing (all of the time). So, a couple of free burritos will bring me back, for the mere convenience. 

Observations since my recent return 
+ They are fast as shit now on the assembly line. They are moving, moving, moving. In and out in minutes. Not certain if it is exclusive to this location, or if it is a chain-wide mandate. They're fast here. Faster than fast food. Seriously. 

+ The optional gratuity jar seems plenty of plentiful now during the promotion days. Good for these employees. They deserve it with how fast they are running through the customers. 

+ There are not that many customers here as before. 

Food
A-OK. Adequate enough. I get the chicken because I assume I cannot be easily killed with chicken, or at least have less of a probability. I always get lettuce though and it will be probably what kills me in the end: greens. (Thanks vegans.)

First: ask for the burrito. I think you can double-wrap at no additional cost, although I have never done it. (I have heard as well of the possibility of a quesadilla wrapped burrito from a particularly gluttonous Crossfitter from Kansas City, MO.)
Second: white rice or brown rice. I always pick brown because it is a better colour. (Technically, white isn't event a colour [neither is black.])
Third: black or pinto beans. I always select pinto because it is more fun to say. 
Fourth: type of meat. I select pollo. 
Fifth: pico. I always select pico de gallo. If you can't pronounce it correctly, you might be uneducated. Return to primary school.
Sixth: crema, queso, no guac -- NO GUAC! -- y lechuga. (Translated: sour creme, cheese, lettuce.) 
Seventh: clarify if you wish to dine-in or eat out. Pay. Tip. Go home. 

[777.]

Service
I'm a fan. It used to be slow in the past; however, they whipped them into shape. No lollygagging here! This ain't Burger King®! Promote the till winglady at once upon a slot opening for ascension if she is not already the manager.

Ambiance
A-OK. They all look the same; this one is clean. More than adequate*.
(*Music could be better though. Where are the corridos, coño?)

Parking
A-OK. It's free yet scarce anywhere near the restaurant on most nights. I park to the south or west in the lot and just walk. There is always parking along Pizza Hut® (because it's Pizza Hut). Walking is probably good for you.

Pro Tip: the free menu item offer was available for a day -- I think -- and good for the month. Apologies if this tip is dated and not useful to you at this time. (Isn't that the case with all tips?)

Pro Tip: the restrooms are around the back a la izquierda. 

Pro Tip: this is definitely the smallest Chipotle location I have ever been in. 

Final Word
I am not sure if I am back-back, but they sure got me back at least for a couple of visits. Dropping a couple of dollars in the tip jar and eating essentially free burritos is good para el alma. 

-------------------------------------

Tourists
None here: it's far from the strip.

Kids
Good for 'em+. (+Teach them early how to say pico.)

Dogs
Leave them at home unless they are service-providing.

-------------------------------------

Rating: Three-stars, "A-OK." [5000 max limit.]

Great service, friendly faces, tasty food! This place isn't overly crowded so you get very quick service and quality food. In addition they value loyal customers. Today I went in and got lunch on the house! Thank you, chipotle!

I give it a 3 1/2 stars.

If I do have the hankering for a semi-authentic Mexican burrito, I'll usually hit up this Chipotle.  Let's face it folks, it's a CHAIN...come in, get food, get out!  They run the business model this way to keep traffic up at a steady pace.  I venture to find most Chipotles are busy during the lunch break times of day.  Of course!  It's fast, simple, and tastes good.

Easy-peasy ordering at Chipotle.  Pick a burrito, bowl, salad, or tacos (crispy or soft).  Choose your carbs: cilantro-lime rice (white or now brown), black or pinto beans.  Pick a meat: grilled chicken or steak, barbacoa (shredded beef), carnitas, or veggies.  Then add your fixings:  choices of a number of salsas, guacamole, cheese, sour cream, and romaine lettuce.  Pick a drink, decide if you want chips and salsa or chips and guacamole.  Or a cerveza!  On average, you should be in and out of the ordering process in less than 30 seconds.  They be fast!  Think - more people per hour, more money made.  Beautiful.

Chipotle boasts being a responsible eatery - they try to use fresh, local ingredients, as well as outsource proteins that are hormone-free.  That is a great marker, but of course, it comes at a price.  An entrée will set you back an average of $6-7.  That's one pricey burrito!  But I guess it's OK to be green sometimes.  Honestly, the way I build a burrito, it's enough for TWO people to share.  Cheap date!

I stick with my basic fave:  burrito with grilled chicken or steak (steak if I'm not feeling cheap), brown rice, black beans, pico de gallo, tomatillo salsa, a dash of corn salsa, cheese, sour cream, and EXTRA lettuce.  By the time that sucker is ready to be folded, it looks like a mini football.  Touchdown!  It's pretty hard for them to fold, in fact, many a tortilla has been ripped because of my order.  I don't care, that's how I like it.  Fatty.

The flavors are good when everything on the line is fresh.  I like the marinade they use on their meats, leaves them juicy and tender.  But two things I really like about Chipotle:

1) Coca-Cola products!  Yes!
2) Their Tabasco stocked hot sauce bar.  Regular, Jalapeno, and Chipotle Tabasco sauces?  So tasty with your meal!  Adds another dimension of flavor and heat.

Chipotle - your McDonald's of the 'gourmet' burrito world!  In fact at one time they really were owned by McDonald's.
Bathroom is disgusting! No paper towels makes me wonder if the employees wash their hands.
Always great food. The only one minor thing I have to say is that the new employees really give you less food than you should actually be getting.

Seriously... Management need to look into portion size.  They are so much smaller here compare to the other locations in town??  I understand meat are expensive and there is a set portion, but lettuce, rice and beans??? And the chips are like 1/3 of the bag... Get a smaller bag and fill it up... At least that will make me feel like I pay for the full bag.

I absolutely love Chipotle. However.... The past couple times I have come to this location I haven't had a good experience. Everyone works with their head down... No eye contact, no smiles and they all work super slow. I stood in line for 15 min last time. Asked for my salsa on the side and they still put it on top... Didn't bother to remake it even though I stated to them that I had asked for it on the side... They clearly didn't care. And their bathrooms were disgusting!! 

Next time I decided to go online and order so I didn't have to wait long. My pick up time was 4:45 and I walked in at 4:47 and guess what.. They had a line and MY ORDER WASNT DONE! They again acted like they didn't care and took their good old time making my one salad I needed. 

Needless to say I'm never going to this location again. The location on Lake Mead is a million times better!!! Go there for a good experience!

Food is your average chipotle food but the service is awful. When I tried to give them a very specific order the employee started making my food before I finished and just ignored me and ended up getting it wrong but made me feel bad that it was already made that I payed for it anyways and did not enjoy it that much. Line is always long and slow very disorganized and rude crew I try to avoid this location as much as possible.

(When you go to this branch or any branch of this fast food, observe how they give portions of the ingredients that you order.)
I  have gone to this Chipotle branch on several occasions and on most of those, I have observed that the size of the serving varies & it depends on the server.
The most recent of this incident was: a customer ahead of me ordered a steak bowl. Either that customer was a good acquaintance of the server or was just having a fun time with their little chit-chat. I noticed the customer was given a good size heap full of each ingredient that was ordered. My turn came, ordered the same thing and was given what I would say a bit less of an average serving. I had to ask the server if she could put just a tadbit more. The cheese and the lettuce are measured by how big the hand of the server is and how much they deem to put! Some grab by the handful and some would just grab half a handful. What's up with that?? This has happened more than once so I finally decided to write the company about this.
They said they follow a 'calorie information' for their servings. 
Well I guess this 'calorie info' depends on who is serving you! 
I will be going to this Chipotle branch again in the near future to see IF the company heeded my comment and IF there are changes. If none, then it's time to find a more authentic mexican fast food that hopefully gives a uniform & fair serving to every customer! We're all paying customers so we should all get the same amount of servings.

Awful. If I could give negative stars I would. The chicken in my bowl was raw and slimy or pink. I called to let them know they were serving raw chicken and the manager told me she could refund my money, but I would have to come back in for a refund. It could be reversed to my card Witt my receipt number. Horrible customer service. Cold food. I will never return. Hopefully I'm not sick all night from the few pieces I didn't spit out before I threw the whole thing away.

These large national chains don't really need Yelp reviews to help their business, like small mom and pop shops, and most people coming to one for the first time aren't driven here by these reviews. People come here because of the known quality and huge national tv and other ad campaigns but people should still know about this specific location and ones personal experience had here. 
I come here quite regularly for lunch and have always had good quality food and service. The facilities are well keep and clean and you're usually in and out in no time no matter how busy they are. 
Definitely a good choice, although maybe not a healthy one, for lunch or dinner. My suggestion is a chicken burrito, bag of chips and Diet Coke. The Diet Coke makes it a healthy meal. Right?

I like this spot good customer service and they always seem to remember me which is nice. But that being said I really feel like the flavor has become one note with the food here. I tend to get the steak or chicken on most of my visits if you want something different try the hot sauce and guac. But the truth is eventually the allure will wear off and you will just go out of habit.

Where do I start The quesadillas were not cut, the tacos were falling apart because the tortillas seemed stale, the chicken on both was dry and overcooked and finally the 3 bags of chips were also stale!! $35. for bad food!! We moved here and thought Chipotle was supposed to be a consistent quality chain, never had any problem where we used to live, now we know better!!

Used to go to Chipotle all the time was always pretty good.We were there today had three steak burritos the burritos were cold and meat was undercooked also had tortilla chips which tasted uncooked and a little soggy as well. Don't think I would go back I would stick with zabas or Cafe Rio

I'm a fan of Chipotle, and this was the first time visiting this location. There was no kids menu posted but when we asked they said they could do kids items. The guy starting our food was really nice. They were out of brown rice (frowney face). Overall, food was good but it seemed a little disorganized. We had to wait for someone to come finish our order and take our payment.  I think they were getting ready for the dinner shift because most of the employees were preparing food in the kitchen.

I don't even know where to start. 

Soggy burrito. 
Lumpy, tasteless salsa. 
Stale chips. 
Hard tortilla. 


It was like 9pm,and I really wanted a burrito, just not Roberto's (which I love btw), and I always get a burrito bowl from Chipotle, so I thought: "what the hell, never tried their burritos let's give it a shot."

Worst mistake of my life and I knew there was a reason I shied away from tacos/burritos from this place. When I began to order, they immediately informed me that they were out of chicken and steak, only had pork. I don't usually eat pork but I was jonesin' for a burrito, so I shrugged and said "that's cool, I would like some barbacoa". When I received my burrito, I just left the location, took it home and prepared to feast. 

Then I removed it from the bag. 

The bag was literally see-through,  it was so drenched in juices. 

It got all over my car seat, and my kitchen table. 

I should've stopped there. But no, I continued. 

I picked it up, the whole outside of the foil was wet. For some reason it was wrapped in two pieces of foil and although I asked for salsa on the side, it was still poured on top. I opened the foil, the burrito was red from the salsa. Soggy. Would not stay together in my hands. 

"Did I eat it? "you may be asking. Yes, I did. And it wasn't like it was a freak accident. My roommate ordered the same thing and got the same result. 

I didn't expect 5 star cuisine, Chipotle. I really did not. But,  damn. 

Will never eat here again.

I am not going to lie. But after the entire salmonella outbreak at Chipotle I was kind of nervous about still eating there. I did go there the other day for the first time since that story came out. Although I did not have the chicken even though it's probably safer now. I ended up getting a steak Bowl which was still delicious and great quality plus you can eat steak Raw which made me less nervous about eating there this time. I'm sure after everything that happened that they fixed the entire issue now but I am still a bit weary of eating the chicken.LMAO!!!

Only one person working the line, one girl cooking, 2 girls at the register talking about the latest funny snap o gram or something, and 2 others just walking around. Then the general manager leisurely washes her hands for all of 5 sec and then puts on gloves. And of course with the manager making my bowl I got the smallest portion possible. I know about food cost and portion control,  but it seems like she made up her entire food cost for the day on my bowl. I got the carnitas, and I could tell by them using the small container, that they don't sell a lot of it. BUT, that means you have to stir it around because it's hot on the bottom, but the top gets cold. And that's what I got. The cold stuff on top. After all the toppings it barely cleared the top of the bowl. I guess it was ration Sunday. The bowl was goodish, the cold pork really killed it. And the pinch of rice and beans made it not so filling. Sorry chipotle. U really need to step it up at this one.

Normally this location is pretty great, but it has been quite a while since I've eaten there. Today, I went in with my boyfriend and noticed that the line workers were different which isn't necessarily a bad thing, just something I noticed. The girl that helped us (10/27 at 3 pm) did not greet us. I asked her how she was doing and she stared at me until I said, "I'll have a bowl please." She asked me three times what kind of beans I'd like and then without asking, put a scoop of steak on my bowl. I informed her I didn't want any meat and she responded with "So you want me to start over?" And then rolled her eyes as she threw away the bowl. I then asked for sofritas, she added bell peppers. I asked her again for sofritas, she rolled her eyes yet again, and then copped an attitude with me until she was done filling my boyfriend's order. The girl at the register was sweet and the girl on the grill was working insanely hard. The girl working as a line server just really put a bad taste in my mouth for this location.

Stopped by here for a quick snack.  I have had the Carnitas and Chicken before and I liked them.  This time I went for the Barbacoa soft Taco.  I would probably recommend having this in either a Burrito or crunchy Taco due to the moisture factor of some of the ingredients.  It was a messy eat.  Other than the assembly issues the flavor was good.  The Guac has a good amount of citrus in it, just the way I like it, so I didn't mind the extra topping fee.  Sustainable and organic ingredients make me feel a little better about the six tacos I'm eating.
Quick, friendly, Delish, tried sofritas bowl for first time was best bowl I've ever had!!! Keep up the good work!!

Went to this location around 2:00pm on Thursday March 19th.

Line staff was arguing with cooks. Line was completely out of both rice, chicken and sour cream. Had to wait 10 minutes for a restock.
Then line staff not listening to order, had to repeat I wanted my sauce on the side twice, it was still poured on top of my burrito. Then the burrito was busted, line staff would not remake, wrapped burrito in two tin foils and put it in a bowl. Terrible experience.
Went to this Chipotle at 8:30 pm after a 12+ hour work day.  Bought a grilled chicken burrito bowl and chips to go.  Can't believe they charged for such horrible stale chips.  Shame on you Chipotle!

I usually mix it up between a steak or chick bowl. I love that its always fresh disregarding the crazy line that comes every so often. I tried switching up to a burrito but did not find it wrapped so tightly that ended up using my fork to scope the rest of the meat! I always hit this spot at least once a week because its just awesome!

Okay so I slowly and cautiously came back to this spot. It's a good quick option by the house and good when they keep it fresh. I just won't come during a slack time/ right before closing again. I don't think it was food poisoning, but definitely something was off and upset my stomach enough to reject it. The past few times, I've been absolutely fine. 

I appreciate they do brown rice now, I prefer that in my bowls actually. I normally get steak or carnitas but have been getting the chicken as a better option.

Keep in mind that while they tout "healthy" there is still a rather crazy amount of sodium in their food for a "fresh" concept. So if you are watching what you eat, you should probably look online at their nutritional information.

Chipotle is one of those chains that I would begrudgingly say is rather good and is kinda a genius concept for fast food.

I am a "tourist" in this town and this Chipotle is a bit hard to find. It sits on the North end of the lot next to the Golden Spoon (yum) and the Starbucks. Plenty of places to park.. And one huge plus about this Chipotle is that it's right next to a Courtyard. So you can sit out on one of those warm sunny days and enjoy your food choice. 

Came in yesterday around 4pm before going to the movies with my brother and ordered a burrito bowl. Preparers were nice and not stingy and place was well kept. I rarely find a Chipotle that varies in the food quality, (ie: overcooked rice) and this Chipotle holds up to the standards. 

Wasn't busy at all. No line and about 4 people eating in the restaurant. 

No complaints from me nor my brother. We have Chipotle at least once when we're out traveling.

Worst Chipotle restaurant ever.  I mean, don't get me wrong...I love chipotle!! But this location is horrible.  They are always out of something, whether it is meat, sofritas or guac.  They also close early or without notice?! WHO DOES THAT? Why are you closing early with no notice, rhyme or reason.  Another time, they were closed because they were "having a private party."  Why can't you close off half of you restaurant so other people can get Chipotle?  The service is sub-par.  Employees weren't that friendly.    Thank goodness a Chipotle opened up closer to my house.  Will be going there from now on.

Good food, good prices, and a really nice staff.
They have an iPhone app!
Fake Mexican food, it's still good. Nice clean restaurant location. Outdoor seating is available. Affordable food.

I visit this location often and I've seen unsanitary things quite a few times now and today I walked out because it was so bad. 
While I was standing in line I noticed there were so many employees behind the counter and it looked very unorganized (like nobody was sure what to do next, seemed overstaffed and managed very poorly) Considering there were so many employees it was extremely slow. I noticed 3 people back where the chef area was, chatting while one guy was chopping up something WITH NO GLOVES, and the other guy chatting only had 1 glove on (what's the point?), at that point I almost left, but it wasn't until I got up to the counter to order this guy kept sniffling and took the top of his hand and wiped all his snot on top of his glove and he DID NOT change them. I wasn't about to put my child or myself at risk to get sick, so I left. Also while in line a girl came randomly from the back with NO gloves on and started stirring everything. I won't be back to this location for a very long time.

Quick service and the food is good. Since the food scare the lines have reduced but I believe that their food is cleaner than many fast food or even regular restaurants. The workers are usually friendly and courteous. Good for lunch when looking for Mex inspired food
We love this place & eat here at least twice a week! Yummy!

I use to LOVE chipotle and have never had an issue with this location, until I got the Barbacoa bowl to go. Within a matter of 5-7 hours, I woke up in the middle of the night to food poisoning. Just imagine everything coming out of every possible exit from your body and that is what I dealt with for 24 hours. I didn't think the E Coli had reached Vegas!!! BEWARE!!!!! Worst feeling I have ever had.

I rate all chipotle locations on the following factors 1) meat portions  2) how clean the lobby is ....


With that said this chipotle is usually pretty good about adhering to Chipotle's meat policy (a full scoop ) every once in a while you'll have an employee who finesses the meat portions but that doesn't happen to often. The lobby is usually clean. Lastly , the line moves pretty swiftly. 

Overall , chipotle is good , affordable and cheap. You usually know what you're getting.

Chipotle is my weakness! This one is near my house, almost too close. I have visited other Chipotle's around town but this is the one that of course I favor constantly. I have never come here and had to stand in a long line like the one near the outlet malls. I am usually in and out in less than 10 minutes and I like that. 

I think the food tastes nice and fresh with some good flavor. I usually get chicken tacos with just lettuce, cheese, and pico on it. Simple to the point and so yummy! If I have been a good girl I will get some chips and guac. I love their guac, I am drooling right now. 

This particular stop is always clean, fast and the service is always friendly. I don't think I can think of one time when I have had bad service here. That definitely helps me visit this location more often.
Great spot for some good quick healthy food. They also let me take my dog in the patio area!.
My first time at this Chipotle and I really have nothing negative to say.  The service was great and the food was fresh!  Good job.
Amazing! As always, Chipotle. The only thing you could do better is to give me more of that amazingness in a bowl. Larger rations!

So I went back and forth writing this review because I am a frequent Chipotle customer and have never had anything like this happen, but figured management needed to know. I was in this last Friday night, and what looked like the cook was back eating chips straight out of one of the containers they serve them out of. The container was sitting right on the stove and I'm not sure if they were old chips they were throwing out or fresh ones they just finished cooking...? Either way it seemed off to just be eating chips straight out of the container you serve them in front of customers, right where all the other food is cooked. The thing that really weirded me out was when the girl ringing up my order grabbed some chips, also out of this container as she was coming to take my money. To the point where she was chewing and covered her mouth with her hand and sort of laughed it off as she told me the total. Then, took my money and went back for more chips. Just seemed like this wouldn't even met sanitation requirements. Like I said, I'm not sure if they were old chips getting ready to be thrown out or fresh ones... Either way... Is there not a better place or time to eat chips than right where all the food is served in front of customers? Unprofessional and unsanitary.

This location is so chinsy on the portions.  This is the worst one I have been to in the valley. Why can't we have normal portions like all the other Chipotle's in Vegas?!  You would think the food cost comes out of the employees pockets!  Boo Chipotle on Durango.

One of my FAVORITE PLACES!! I love the Chicken Bowl. The dressing is awesome!!!
I am hooked!!! When in the mood for a good salad this is where I go!!!

This Chipotle leaves a lot to be desired!  The service is horrible because they will get the order wrong 3 out of 4 
times!  Today was the best though I ordered a bowl and said no lettuce and they put it on.  I told them again no lettuce and they put it on again!  3 times they got it wrong till I finally gave up and took it.  I complained to the girl at checkout and she said I'm not the manager!   Really!!

Normally I would give any chipotle 4 to 5 stars, but today this location gets 3. They had 2 guys (who were new) working the front and they seemed lost and none of veteran staff were helping them out. Normally you are greeted when you get to the front, but not a word from anyone. Just awkward eye contact for 5 minutes. I actually witnessed one of the guys roll his very first burrito because he's so new. Would have been nice if somebody with experience was overseeing and correcting small mishaps instead of me helping them out with scoop sizes and what not. The new guys did pretty good just SUPER slow.

I love chipotle steak bowl but this place always runs out of bell peppers and when I ask to wait for extra bell peppers they give me an attitude. I have gone here several times and it has been a while since I went back.

I thought this was a great chipotle location. 
Came inside and was greeted immediately by one of their staff members. There was no line so I got right to ordering! The girl who was in the beginning stages of making the burrito was really funny and was poking fun with me at my boyfriend for not ordering something.
The burrito was chalk-full of everything. I mean they filled that baby up! 
The barbacoa was really tasty, I was shocked when my boyfriend said it wasn't sitting in that a lot of liquid in the trays before they put it in my burrito because it tasted like it was sitting in a vat of deliciousness for awhile before hand! 
Thank god this location is so close to my boyfriends parents house. I will be back here again on visits!

The staff is quick. 
The bowls are a decent size. 
Everyone's always in a good mood unlike the Chipotle on Lake Mead. 

They always have my online orders done when I walk in.

I can't really complain about anything. :)
